post_text:
Michelle Obama is reading books to kids every Monday at noon on @pbskids!
・・・
As a young parent, I found so much joy in rediscovering my favorite children’s books with my daughters. The time I spent reading with them, creating voices for our favorite characters and beaming with pride as they started to recognize words and read along, is something we all still cherish to this day.

As First Lady, I had the privilege of sharing my love of stories with children everywhere, and today, I’m excited to pick that back up with “The Gruffalo”—my first read-along in what will be a four-week series with @PBSKids and @PenguinRandomHouse. I hope you’ll tune in today with your family at 12pm ET on PBS Kids’s YouTube channel or Facebook page!

We were thrilled to have seven Ascend leaders attend Teach For America’s School Leaders of Color Conference this past weekend in Dallas, and honored to have been selected as the only public charter network to organize and facilitate a session. Entitled “Beyond No Excuses: Implementing Responsive and Restorative Practices at Scale,” we shared with more than 100 attendees Ascend’s story of rejecting harsh discipline practices in favor of a warm, nurturing culture that today is driving dramatic academic gains across our schools.

We thank TFA’s Collective for organizing this weekend. It was incredibly powerful to convene this group of accomplished leaders and to marvel at the collective impact we are having across the country!

According to the ACLU, black students nationwide are suspended and expelled at a rate three times higher than their white peers, resulting in more missed school days and a higher dropout rate. This school-to-prison pipeline has regrettably become a part of America’s educational status quo.

Join us tomorrow, November 14 at 6:00 pm for a candid discussion about Ascend Public Charter Schools’ challenge to the zero-tolerance school policies that contribute to the school-to-prison pipeline for young people of color. You will hear from Founder and CEO Steven F. Wilson and Managing Director of Schools Marsha Gadsden how a mission-driven organization had the courage to shift from a “No Excuses” culture where students were joyless to one that fosters welcoming learning environments and empowers students.
